command-def.name: cut - remove sections from each line of the input

methods.method: Cuts the fields or characters from the input line and writes them to the standard output. Depending on the provided options and operands, range, delimiter or indexes define the cut.
Cuts the fields or characters using the given range from the input line and writes them to the output.
Cuts the fields or characters using the given indexes from the input line and writes them to the output.
Cuts the fields using the given range from the input line and writes them to the output.
Cuts the fields using the given indexes from the input line and writes them to the output.
Cuts the fields using the given range and using the given delimiter from the input line and writes them to the output using the given outputDelimiter.
Cuts the fields using the given indexes and using the given delimiter from the input line and writes them to the output using the given outputDelimiter.

options.option: The list specifies fields, separated in the input by the field delimiter character (see the -d option.) Output fields are separated by a single occurrence of the field delimiter character.

operands.operand: use as the output delimiter the default is to use the input delimiter
use as the output delimiter the default is to use the input delimiter
select these chars/field based on the given indexes. Indexes are 1 based. i.e. the first character/field on a line has an index of 1.

String arguments defining the options and operands for the command. Options can be specified by acronym (with a leading dash "-") or by long name (with two leading dashes "--"). Operands other than the default "--range" operand have to be prefixed with the operand name (e.g. "--indexes" for subsequent index operand values).
